handleAutoIncPreDmlExecute

public java.lang.Object handleAutoIncPreDmlExecute(java.sql.Connection conn,
                                                   java.lang.String seqOrTableName,
                                                   java.lang.String autoIncColumnName)
                                            throws java.sql.SQLException
Description copied from interface: DatabasePolicy
When an auto increment value is needed in a SQL insert, this method is called before the execution of the insert statement. This gives the DatabasePolicy to go get a sequence value or do whatever is necessary in order to fill in the auto inc value into the columnNames, columnValues (which are the DML items being filled out by the DmlTask object. In case sequences are not used, this method will just do nothing and wait for the handleAutoIncPostDmlExecute to be called.
Overrides:
handleAutoIncPreDmlExecute in class BasicDatabasePolicy
Following copied from interface: com.netspective.sparx.xif.db.DatabasePolicy
Parameters:
conn - The database connection to use
seqOrTableName - The sequence name or the table name
autoIncColumnName - The name of the column that is the auto inc column
Returns:
The auto inc value generated by the database or null if not known yet

handleAutoIncPreDmlExecute

public java.lang.Object handleAutoIncPreDmlExecute(java.sql.Connection conn,
                                                   com.netspective.sparx.util.value.ValueContext vc,
                                                   java.lang.String seqOrTableName,
                                                   java.lang.String autoIncColumnName,
                                                   java.util.List columnNames,
                                                   java.util.List columnValues)
                                            throws java.sql.SQLException
Description copied from interface: DatabasePolicy
When an auto increment value is needed in a SQL insert, this method is called before the execution of the insert statement. This gives the DatabasePolicy to go get a sequence value or do whatever is necessary in order to fill in the auto inc value into the columnNames, columnValues (which are the DML items being filled out by the DmlTask object. In case sequences are not used, this method will just do nothing and wait for the handleAutoIncPostDmlExecute to be called.
Overrides:
handleAutoIncPreDmlExecute in class BasicDatabasePolicy
Following copied from interface: com.netspective.sparx.xif.db.DatabasePolicy
Parameters:
conn - The database connection to use
vc - The ValueContext being used to fill the DmlTask columns and values
seqOrTableName - The sequence name or the table name
autoIncColumnName - The name of the column that is the auto inc column
columnNames - The list of column names prepared for use in the DmlTask prior to calling this method
columnValues - The list of column values prepared for use in the DmlTask prior to calling this method
Returns:
The auto inc value generated by the database or null if not known yet

retainAutoIncColInDml

public boolean retainAutoIncColInDml()
Description copied from interface: DatabasePolicy
Returns a boolean value whether to retain autoinc columns in any insert or update DMLs. Required because SQL Server does not allow including the column in either case, generating an exception if it is
Overrides:
retainAutoIncColInDml in class BasicDatabasePolicy

appendInsertSqlForAutoInc

public java.lang.String appendInsertSqlForAutoInc()

handleAutoIncPostDmlExecute

public java.lang.Object handleAutoIncPostDmlExecute(java.sql.Connection conn,
                                                    java.lang.String seqOrTableName,
                                                    java.lang.String autoIncColumnName,
                                                    java.lang.Object autoIncColumnValue)
                                             throws java.sql.SQLException
Description copied from interface: DatabasePolicy
When an auto increment value is needed in a SQL DML, this method is called after the execution of the DML (insert, update, or delete). This gives the DatabasePolicy to go get a sequence value or do whatever is necessary in order to return the auto inc value.
Overrides:
handleAutoIncPostDmlExecute in class BasicDatabasePolicy
Following copied from interface: com.netspective.sparx.xif.db.DatabasePolicy
Parameters:
conn - The database connection to use
vc - The ValueContext being used to fill the DmlTask columns and values
seqOrTableName - The sequence name or the table name
autoIncColumnName - The name of the column that is the auto inc column
autoIncColumnValue - The value of the auto inc column returned by handleAutoIncPreDmlExecute method
Returns:
The auto inc value generated by the database or null if not known yet
